channel.title: Peter O'Shaughnessy
channel.description: Tech geek, web developer and advocate

item.title: Samsung Internet at MozFest!
item.description: Reporting back from the 7th annual Mozilla Festival, “the world’s leading festival for the open internet movement”.

item.title: Is browser still the right word?
item.description: With the rise of progressive web app technologies, web browsers are more capable than ever. So much so, that the word “browser” doesn’t really fit anymore.

item.title: Bytes Conf 2016 and spreading the word about PWAs
item.description: I was fortunate enough to be one of the speakers at BytesConf, where I spoke about PWAs and Samsung Internet.

item.title: Highlights from Google's Progressive Web Apps Training in London
item.description: Google kindly invited us to “Building Progressive Web Apps”, a 3-day PWA bootcamp covering service workers, push notifications, Web Payments, responsive design and more.

item.title: How are Progressive Web Apps helping communities and businesses?
item.description: Web developers have probably heard lots of buzz about PWAs by now, but why are they important? I'm collecting together stories and examples of how they have helped people, communities and businesses.

item.title: Things I learned making a Progressive Web App for super selfies
item.description: A simple demo turned into a lot of learning about service workers, client-side image downloads and more.

item.title: If Leicester win the league, it will be a victory for hackers and tinkerers everywhere
item.description: Our ethos at pebble {code} appears to align with that of Leicester’s manager, Claudio Ranieri...

item.title: Web Bluetooth - Controlling the Real World from your Browser
item.description: The Connected Devices revolution, why I believe Web Bluetooth is the most exciting new browser API, and why drone flipping is my new favourite use of JavaScript.

item.title: Productivity Hacking for Developers
item.description: “There’s nothing you can’t do if you get the habits right.”

item.title: Robots, Virtual Reality and the Internet of Things? I Can't Believe It's JavaScript!
item.description: Many of the kinds of applications that we previously would have considered impossible to build in JavaScript, are now possible.

item.title: Solving Big Data for Humans
item.description: Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality could help to make data more user-centred, intuitive and engaging.

item.title: Combining React and WebGL
item.description: React is great for building user interfaces, but how does it fit in with WebGL?

item.title: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Coding
item.description: Your IDE could be about to get really, really smart.

item.title: Talking to primary school children about programming
item.description: If it's possible to inspire just one or two...

item.title: 2020 - Looking Ahead To The Future of Web Development
item.description: What will web development look like in the year 2020?

item.title: Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality for Education
item.description: Prototypes that start to hint at how AR and VR could transform education.

item.title: Enter the Metaverse - Introducing Virtual Reality for the Web (WebVR)
item.description: Virtual Reality is hitting the Web and this is why it's exciting...

item.title: The Future of the Web and What It Means for Education
item.description: What did the Future of Web Apps conference tell us about the future of education?

item.title: Interfaces of the future, and how to hack around with them now
item.description: The Web is moving out from behind the screen...

item.title: The Full Spectrum Developer
item.description: Why Michael Feathers thinks we should broaden our horizons.
